issues.description: The problem statement and UML refer to an interface named 'Rideable' (with method messageOnRide()), and the template/Main comments also reference 'Rideable'. However, the solution implementation does not implement or use a functional 'Rideable' interface: there is an empty Rideable.java in the solution and the solution instead declares/uses an interface named 'Mountable' (Mountable.java) which is implemented by Pig and Seal. This renaming / missing interface causes a type-name mismatch and an absent Rideable contract. Students following the problem statement (or the template comments) will implement a 'Rideable' interface, but the solution's classes use 'Mountable' — and the provided Rideable.java is empty — which is a structural inconsistency that will cause confusion and may prevent compilation or correct linking if students compare against the solution or try to use the provided solution files as reference.
issues.suggested_fix: Make the interface name and usage consistent across all artifacts. Preferably: (a) Rename Mountable.java to Rideable.java (or add a Rideable interface) and ensure it declares String messageOnRide(); (b) Update Pig.java and Seal.java to implement Rideable (not Mountable); (c) Remove or populate the empty Rideable.java in the solution so it matches the problem statement UML. Alternatively, update the problem statement and template to reference 'Mountable' instead of 'Rideable' (less recommended). This preserves the intended teaching goal while removing confusion.

issues.description: The problem statement and the template refer to a 'Rideable' interface (with method messageOnRide()) as the interface representing rideable animals. In the solution repository that same concept is implemented under a different interface name 'Mountable' (solution/src/de/tum/cit/ase/Mountable.java) and the solution classes Pig and Seal implement Mountable. Additionally, solution/src/de/tum/cit/ase/Rideable.java is present but empty. This mismatch (Rideable vs. Mountable) breaks the one-to-one mapping between the exercise description/template and the provided solution, creating confusion about which interface students should implement/use and risking failing or misleading tests that expect the 'Rideable' identifier.
issues.suggested_fix: Unify the interface name across all artifacts. Preferred fix: in the solution repository, replace the 'Mountable' interface with the name 'Rideable' (define interface Rideable { String messageOnRide(); }), update Pig.java and Seal.java to implement Rideable instead of Mountable, and remove or populate the empty Rideable.java file so there is a single, consistent interface. Alternatively, change the problem/template to refer to 'Mountable' — but keeping 'Rideable' is recommended to match the exercise wording. Ensure the method signature messageOnRide() remains identical.
